ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Slashing weapons for bards question...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Whoa.  Talk about reading more into a message that the author intended.  I never said he was a fool.  I said the buyer was probably laughing all the way to
ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 24 Mar 2000, Kevin L. Crawford wrote:
>
> Don't belittle him just because he sold his item for a price he liked. I
> fail to understand the mentality that so many players have that "You're a
> fool because you sold that item for XYZ coins!" It's his business and he

Whoa. Talk about reading more into a message that the author
intended. I never said he was a fool. I said the buyer was
probably laughing all the way to the bank because he knew he'd
taken advantage of him.

> had his reasons. Picking on him is just going to make him feel put upon and
> put down on. He chose to do it, it's over. He knows he could have made
> more money.
>
> Picking on him about it really is out of line. Especially when I'm sure
> each of us, at one time or another, has made a stupid sale or trade. I

I'm not picking on him. I'm confirming that the true value of
these things is in the 25-35pp range. I don't care what he
chooses to do with that knowledge. I just wanted to be sure
he knew the true value, because I hate jerks who take
advantage of newbies ignorant about prices.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
